reviews.text: We stayed at the Los Linajes Hotel for the last two nights of our 10-day trip around northern Spain in May 2008. We had been staying in modern, recently renovated hotels so Los Linajes was a bit of a let down in comparison. The hotel has a musty smell, probably due to the old wall-to-wall carpeting, and the decor is outdated too. However, the hotel is charming in its own way, and our room had a lovely view of the Iglesia de la Vera Cruz and the surrounding hills. Also, it’s located just a short walk away from the old part of town. The staff, while not overly friendly, was pleasant enough and gave us a really great restaurant recommendation for our last night in Spain – Meson la Cueva. One piece of advice: if you are driving a mini-van or a van you may not want to park in the hotel garage – you have to drive through very narrow streets in the heart of the old city to get to the garage and the clearance is low.
reviews.title: Outdated but Overall a Good Choice

reviews.text: For the price this is the absolute gem other contributing reviewers tell you it is. Especially liked the views, location, and roof top mirador. Quirky it might be but we would stay here every visit to Segovia. As with the rest of Segovia the hotel has lots of stairs (or lifts for those of you who can't do stairs).
reviews.title: You can't go wrong with this hotel

reviews.text: A group of 16 of us (learning Spanish!) enjoyed a 3 night stay here in March. Get a suite with a balcony if you can - we had lovely views over a nearby monastery. The balcony is also nice for lunch. Staff were really helpful and the location is great - only 5 minutes from the main square. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very unique, clean hotel. lots of character. had balcony and terrace view above hotel is wonderful. would definitely stay again
reviews.title: charming hotel

likes.liked: — lots of character, old and new
likes.disliked: — carpeting in room could have been updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at 15 different hotels during our 5 week touring holiday in Spain and South-West France and we definitely would put this one among the top 3. With a bit of luck but and the directions supplied when we booked we found it with no difficulty at all and even managed to approach it in the right direction along the one-way street. We dropped off our bags and got excellent and easy-to-follow directions to the garage parking beneath the hotel (would not be easy to find without directions). Once there you just take the lift into the hotel. The man on reception was so helpful over this. I do sympathise though with the reviewer who in spite of booking parking was told on arrival that it was full – that would certainly take the edge off the whole experience. We not only advance booked the parking but also called 2 days ahead and on the day of arrival to stress that we had done so; perhaps it’s a good idea to do that, just to be sure.
reviews.title: Superb - one of the best stays of our holiday

reviews.text: A charming hotel in the perfect area of the old city. The staff were delightful and the room was perfect for 3 people.
reviews.title: A gem in wonderful Segovia

reviews.text: Stayed here with a tour group. Lots of stairs - you go up to go down and vice versa. Our non-smoking room was definitely smoking before, but aired out ok. Tired carpets, bedspreads, etc., but basically clean and comfortable. Nice view from hotel window.
reviews.title: A little run down, but great location

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights in February, I ended up taking a double room because there were no singles left. The hotel is in the old town - I would recommend staying inside the old town if you visit Segovia for tourism as the new town is some distance away. But it is also slightly away from the main centre (I am talking literally 5 minutes on foot) which means there is more chance of peace & quiet at night for a good nights sleep and also you get views over the countryside.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, a few quirks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was February, but the hotel was warm. It also has air condtioning. The bed was very comfortable. Reception is staffed 24 hours and all three of the staff were very helpful. The bath is almost long enough to lie down in completely (this is Spain) and the shower was absolutely fantastic.
reviews.title: Good location, good value and got a garage - but water noise from other rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is an extremely useful vending machine down on floor 0 for snacks and things. Other than that, I did not eat in the hotel. Food in Segovia is very expensive by Spanish standards but a couple of minutes from the hotel is the Cuevas de San Estefan, which is authentically Spanish (ie not touristy!!!) and does a menu from morning to night at 15.50 Euros.
reviews.title: Loved Los Linajes

reviews.text: I was part of a class at the the IE Universidad in Segovia and stayed at Los Linajes for eight days. The hotel was very close to the IE Universidad, although inside the walls of the old town of Segovia, and the walk down the hill was a little faster than the walk up the hill back to the hotel. Also, the wifi service was a bit unreliable. Talking to the reception desk did help some of the people in our group. All in all, the hotel was in a great location and it was very easy to get to the center of the old town by walking.
reviews.title: Good, solid hotel with charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the rooms were different and mine was fine. It was on the floor above the restaurant and bar and overlooked the valley. I noticed there were other rooms that faced the town or buildings instead and I was glad to have such a lovely view. My room was a good size and I especially liked the large window that opened out to the valley. Some of the other rooms had a balcony and different layouts -- each had its own character. I did like that my room let in a lot of light.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in Segovia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a nice outdoor patio as well as bar and food service. It was nice to have that option available, especially for gathering before dinner. The breakfast in the morning was ample, with an assortment of breads, tortilla patatas, cereals, sliced meats, and juice along with excellent coffee and little pots of tea.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in old town
Our room looked nothing like the hotel's photos
reviews.text: The hotel had a rooftop terrace as well. It had a great view of the valley and part of the old town, and if you were lucky, close view of the storks in the nest next to the hotel. The staff was somewhat friendly, although I felt badly that I could only speak a little Spanish when talking to the reception staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at Los Linajes and would return again, although I would request a room with a balcony and a small table!
reviews.title: The biggest bed we saw in Spain

reviews.text: This characterful property overlooking the Eresma valley, has been carefully modernised to provide comfortable accommodation convenient to the historic centre of the city. We were a party of 8 and had booked direct with the hotel some months ago for a 3 night stay. Each of us commented favourably on the size and quality of our rooms. There were no mini-bars, flat screen t.v's or fluffy bathrobes; but there were excellent beds, good quality linens and plenty of space, in the room itself, in the bathroom and in the wardrobes. Reception was efficient and responsive and the buffet breakfast was more than adequate and in line with or better than Spanish hotels in this price range.
reviews.title: Buena situación y buen valor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At Euros55 a night (plus taxes) for bed and breakfast this represented very good value for money.
reviews.title: reasonable price and terrific bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is situated high on the hill so there are wonderful views.Though the carpet in the bedroom was worn and the TV was old and the two pillows were kind of simple, the bathroom was newly updated. The water pressure was excellent, they provided sturdy plush towels, and the stone tiled surfaces seemed very clean. This location was hard to arrive at by car due to some road construction and rerouting but signs helped and I liked the cobblestone location as a base to explore both the city aqueducts and the Cathederal.
reviews.title: Little Gem of a hotel

reviews.text: We stayed one night whilst travelling to Malaga from Santander. We had stayed before at the Los Linajes and were looking forward to our visit. We were driving with a car which was packed with stuff. The large Garage was very secure and that was one reason for staying there. Our room was a suite with a separate balcony with table and two chairs. It so very comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable hide-away in the heart of old Segovia

reviews.text: The hotel is ideally placed for sightseeing in Segovia. It is just a 5 minute walk to the Plaza Mayor and the cathedral. It is a pure pleasure staying there. The reception spoke a little English, though we can converse in Spanish.
reviews.title: Castilian charm and cozy comfort in Segovia
